title: How would you go about answering a rhetorical question? - Quora

response.answer_text: A rhetorical question is nothing more than an intellectual exercise, a though experiment. It is an applied approach to a theoretical condition. In effect, the only significant difference between a rhetorical question and one of immediacy is that one has practical implications, the other does not. The rhetorical question is heuristic, causing the one who answers to form ideas about a nonexistent set of circumstances. But answering it requires the identical intellectual tools as does answering any question. So, how would I answer a rhetorical question? I would answer it as if it were not rhetorical because that distinction is immaterial.
Straightforward. Rhetorical questions are in essence, thought provokers. For instance, your question is just that. So there you have it.
